column1: #Text=Polycrystalline ThFeAsN specimens with typical grain sizes 1–5 μm were synthesized by solid-state reaction methods, as recently described in ref. 18.
#Text=The purity of precursors was checked via XRD, while the composition of the final product was determined via EDX spectroscopy.
#Text=The room-temperature XRD of ThFeAsN reveals a tetragonal structure (P4/nmm) with a = 4.037 Å and c = 8.526 Å (see inset in Fig. 1) and no detectable impurity phases.
#Text=The precise determination of the N content is rather challenging.

#Text=While the possibility of N deficiencies cannot be absolutely ruled out, the fact that oxygen vacancies in our 1111 system are stabilized only under high-pressure synthesis suggests that N deficiencies, if present, are negligible.
